I am trying to plot five data frames in a 2 by 3 setting, two rows and three columns, using matplotlib. However, I am encountering an issue where there is an extra empty plot in the 6th position (second row and third column). How can I remove this extra plot so that I only have three plots in the first row and two plots in the second row? Here is the code I am currently using:

```python
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
fig, axes = plt.subplots(nrows=2, ncols=3)

fig.set_figheight(8)
fig.set_figwidth(15)

df[2].plot(kind='bar',ax=axes[0,0]); axes[0,0].set_title('2')
df[4].plot(kind='bar',ax=axes[0,1]); axes[0,1].set_title('4')
df[6].plot(kind='bar',ax=axes[0,2]); axes[0,2].set_title('6')
df[8].plot(kind='bar',ax=axes[1,0]); axes[1,0].set_title('8')
df[10].plot(kind='bar',ax=axes[1,1]); axes[1,1].set_title('10')

plt.setp(axes, xticks=np.arange(len(observations)), xticklabels=map(str,observations),
        yticks=[0,1])

fig.tight_layout()
```

To remove the extra empty plot in the 6th position (second row and third column), you can set that specific subplot to be invisible. This can be done by turning off the axis for that subplot. Here's how you can modify your code to achieve this:

```python
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

# Assuming `observations` is defined somewhere in your code
observations = range(10)  # Placeholder, replace with your actual observation values

fig, axes = plt.subplots(nrows=2, ncols=3)

fig.set_figheight(8)
fig.set_figwidth(15)

df[2].plot(kind='bar', ax=axes[0, 0])
axes[0, 0].set_title('2')

df[4].plot(kind='bar', ax=axes[0, 1])
axes[0, 1].set_title('4')

df[6].plot(kind='bar', ax=axes[0, 2])
axes[0, 2].set_title('6')

df[8].plot(kind='bar', ax=axes[1, 0])
axes[1, 0].set_title('8')

df[10].plot(kind='bar', ax=axes[1, 1])
axes[1, 1].set_title('10')

# Turn off the axis for the empty subplot
axes[1, 2].axis('off')

# Set x and y ticks
plt.setp(axes, xticks=np.arange(len(observations)), xticklabels=map(str, observations), yticks=[0, 1])

fig.tight_layout()

plt.show()
```

This code will make the last subplot (second row, third column) invisible, effectively removing the extra empty plot from your grid layout.
